name: Team Magma's Numel
flavorText: No matter how heavy the cargo, we can transport it to our destination with ease, thanks to Numel.
Attack1Text: Discard an Energy attached to this Pokemon.

name: Team Magma's Camerupt
flavorText: Camerupt, with its strength against fire, played a big role in rescuing team members.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may attach a Fighting or Fire Energy card from your discard pile to this Pokemon.
Attack1Text: Move a basic Energy from this Pokemon to 1 of your Benched Pokemon.

name: Team Aqua's Spheal
flavorText: Spheal's Water Gun can put out any fire. Flames used by opponents have no effect!

name: Team Aqua's Sealeo
flavorText: It provides support by making paths of ice. It can win any battle as long as it's on ice.
Attack1Text: This attack does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)
Attack2Text: If your opponent's Active Pokemon is a Team Magma Pokemon, this attack does 60 more damage.

name: Team Aqua's Walrein
flavorText: It's good at attacks that freeze opponents with a powerful cold snap. Then, it pulverizes a frozen foe with its sharp tusks!
Attack1Text: This attack does 30 damage times the amount of Energy attached to this Pokemon.
Attack2Text: Discard 2 Water Energy attached to this Pokemon. This attack does 80 damage to 2 of your opponent's Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

name: Team Aqua's Kyogre-EX
Ability1Text: If there are 4 or fewer Team Aqua Pokemon in play, this Pokemon can't attack.
Attack1Text: This attack does 20 more damage for each Colorless in your opponent's Active Pokemon's Retreat Cost.

name: Team Aqua's Grimer
flavorText: Its flexible body, which allows it to squeeze into any cracks, comes in handy when invading enemy hideouts.

name: Team Aqua's Muk
flavorText: It immobilizes its opponents by wrapping them in its huge, poisonous body. It'll smoosh you, too!
Ability1Text: The Retreat Cost of each Pokemon in play (except for Team Aqua Pokemon) is Colorless more.
Attack1Text: If your opponent's Active Pokemon is affected by a Special Condition, this attack does 60 more damage.

name: Team Aqua's Seviper
flavorText: Seviper's tail is a sharp blade. It can even poison you!
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Poisoned.
Attack2Text: If your opponent's Active Pokemon is affected by a Special Condition, discard an Energy attached to that Pokemon.

name: Team Magma's Baltoy
flavorText: They all cry out at once to let us know when they spot an enemy. It really helps out!
Attack1Text: This attack does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokemon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

name: Team Magma's Claydol
flavorText: Claydol's beam can seize opponents and keep them from moving. Long-range attacks are its specialty!
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may move a basic Energy from 1 of your Pokemon to 1 of your Team Magma Pokemon.

name: Team Magma's Aron
flavorText: Aron, which even devour metal, can eat and destroy enemy ships in an instant.

name: Team Magma's Lairon
flavorText: When Lairon uses Take Down, the impact from its solid body is enough to destroy concrete!
Attack2Text: This Pokemon does 10 damage to itself.

name: Team Magma's Aggron
flavorText: Aggron's metal horns can smash through any defenses, no matter how strong!
Attack1Text: Discard as many Fighting Energy attached to your Pokemon as you like. This attack does 40 damage times the amount of Fighting Energy you discarded.
Attack2Text: This attack does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokemon that has any damage counters on it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

name: Team Magma's Groudon-EX
Ability1Text: If there are 4 or fewer Team Magma Pokemon in play, this Pokemon can't attack.
Attack1Text: If your opponent's Active Pokemon already has any damage counters on it, this attack does 80 more damage.

name: Team Aqua's Poochyena
flavorText: Poochyena can easily detect invading foes with its acute sense of smell. It's an excellent lookout!
Attack1Text: Your opponent switches his or her Active Pokemon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokemon.

name: Team Magma's Poochyena
flavorText: Poochyena's nose can identify any scent. It's very useful for reconnaissance.
Attack1Text: Your opponent reveals his or her hand.

name: Team Aqua's Mightyena
flavorText: Thanks to Mightyena's outstanding leadership, it's very good at combination attacks that can leave a foe helpless.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin for each Team Aqua Pokemon you have in play. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokemon.

name: Team Magma's Mightyena
flavorText: This Pokemon is loyal to its master. It will protect its partner to the end, no matter what.
Attack2Text: If your opponent's Active Pokemon is a Team Aqua Pokemon, this attack does 40 more damage.

name: Team Aqua's Carvanha
flavorText: You can't keep up with its movements underwater, can you? If you get caught in this whirlpool, there'll be no escape.
Attack1Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

name: Team Aqua's Sharpedo
flavorText: It boasts fangs so powerful that they knock opponents out in one shot! Enemies that slip up will be taken down without fail!
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for a Team Aqua Pokemon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

name: Team Magma's Zangoose
flavorText: Can you handle the formation attack of the fearless Zangoose?
Attack1Text: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Team Magma Pokemon and put them onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.
Attack2Text: This attack does 20 damage times the number of Team Magma Pokemon on your Bench.

name: Aqua Diffuser
Attack1Text: Your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Confused and Poisoned.

name: Magma Pointer
Attack1Text: This attack does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)
